course_title: Critical Writing in Hispanic Topics: Hispanic Humor in Context
class_notes:
CONTENT: This course examines how Latin American and Spanish authors have used different forms of humor (irony, satire, sarcasm, parody, farce) to, among other issues, analyze society, criticize human nature, or undermine elitism. The course will examine the relationship between humor and national identity, neocolonialism, misogyny, social injustice, power, conformity, gender, sexuality and social class.
 
TEXT: Readings will be posted in Canvas. Movie screenings will be required outside of class.
 
EVALUATION: Evaluation is based on class participation, weekly assignments, group presentations, one final group project, and two partial exams.
PREREQUISITE: SPAN 212 or an Official Spanish Placement into our Foundational Course level (Span 300-318). Take the online Spanish Placement Exam at http://spanport.emory.edu/home/undergraduate/placement/index.html.
course_description: This course combines advanced writing instruction with the study of diverse Hispanic cultural topics.
